description.title: 12 V battery : precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: 12 V battery : precautions for the repair

description.title: DANGER: RISK FROM ACID LINKED TO HANDLING

descbody.para: Sulphuric acid is a highly aggressive and toxic substance which corrodes most metals.
When handling batteries, it is very important to take the following precautions:

ul.li: protect your eyes by wearing goggles,

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid any damages and/or injuries dues to potential projection of sulfuric acid, a dangerous substance, contained in 12V battery, rinse all contaminated areas thoroughly in water.If it comes into c
reusenote.para: To avoid any damages and/or injuries dues to potential projection of sulfuric acid, a dangerous substance, contained in 12V battery, rinse all contaminated areas thoroughly in water.
If it comes into contact with the skin or eyes, seek medical attention.

description.title: DANGER: RISK OF EXPLOSION LINKED TO CHARGING AND TO INCORRECT TIGHTENING OF THE TERMINALS

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To prevent damaging the 12V battery or even causing it to explode, do not place any heat sources or create any sparks near a charging 12V battery.
reusenote.para: To prevent damaging the 12V battery or even causing it to explode, do not place any heat sources or create any sparks near a charging 12V battery.

descbody.para: Incorrect tightening could cause heating of contacts, starting or charging faults, sparking, and cause the battery to explode.
When a battery is charging, oxygen and hydrogen are produced. The mixture of these two gases is explosive.
The smallest of sparks or heat sources is enough to cause an explosion. The explosion is so strong that the battery can shatter and spray the acid into the surrounding atmosphere.
People nearby are at risk (exploded fragments, acid splashes). Acid splashes are dangerous. They also damage clothing.
Safeguarding against the danger of explosion, which can be caused by handling a battery carelessly, must be taken very seriously.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid any risk of sparks:Ensure that all electrical consumers are completely switched off.When a 12V battery is being charged indoors, switch off the charger before connecting or disconnecting the
reusenote.para: To avoid any risk of sparks:

ul.li: Ensure that all electrical consumers are completely switched off.
When a 12V battery is being charged indoors, switch off the charger before connecting or disconnecting the 12V battery.
Do not place any metallic items on the 12V battery, as this would cause a short circuit across the terminals.
Never hold a naked flame, welding gun, blowtorch, cigarette or lighted match near to a 12V battery.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid loss of computer functions, observe the following recommendations before disconnecting the 12V battery:wait for the motor-driven fan assembly to stop,wait for the computer to finish saving (5
reusenote.para: To avoid loss of computer functions, observe the following recommendations before disconnecting the 12V battery:

ul.li: wait for the motor-driven fan assembly to stop,
wait for the computer to finish saving (5 minutes).

noteR.para: To avoid unwanted restarting of the engine, before carrying out any operation on a vehicle fitted with the Stop & Start system, always follow the safety instructions (see Vehicle: precautions for the repair).

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid permanently locking the steering column lock, never fit a UCH that has been previously used on another vehicle.
reusenote.para: To avoid permanently locking the steering column lock, never fit a UCH that has been previously used on another vehicle.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid any damage to the wiring, observe the correct orientation of the battery terminal.
reusenote.para: To avoid any damage to the wiring, observe the correct orientation of the battery terminal.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To prevent premature loosening of the stud nuts on the negative terminal, refit a maximum of two terminals per stud and distribute the terminals over different studs.
reusenote.para: To prevent premature loosening of the stud nuts on the negative terminal, refit a maximum of two terminals per stud and distribute the terminals over different studs.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid damaging the bonnet, refit a battery which is identical to the battery originally fitted, in the case of vehicules are only fitted with TB (low height).
reusenote.para: To avoid damaging the bonnet, refit a battery which is identical to the battery originally fitted, in the case of vehicules are only fitted with TB (low height).

noteR.para: DANGER : Risk of serious injuries due to the short-circuiting or the untimely triggering of an electrical system (pyrotechnical parts, windscreen wiper motor, electric fan, etc.) following possible loopback of the 12-volt supply circuit by the voltage transformer.
Please adhere to the instructions regarding cut-off of the 12-volt supply circuit.
If the procedure fails, do not continue with your task and ask an employee who is qualified and authorized to work on a high-voltage onboard network to perform a diagnostic.

descsection.para: Perform the following operations to disconnect the 12-volt supply circuit before carrying out any repair operationsvehicle : lockout - removal of lockoutGIEMR-002439.

noteR.para: DANGER : Risk of serious injuries due to the short-circuiting or the untimely triggering of an electrical system (pyrotechnical parts, windscreen wiper motor, electric fan, etc.) following possible loopback of the 12-volt supply circuit by the voltage transformer.
Please adhere to the instructions regarding cut-off of the 12-volt supply circuit.
If the procedure fails, do not continue with your task and ask an employee who is qualified and authorized to work on a high-voltage onboard network to perform a diagnostic.

descsection.para: Perform the following operations to disconnect the 12-volt supply circuit before carrying out any repair operations12 V supply circuit : lockout - removal of lockoutGIEMR-000508.
